Hello, I'm Isaac. I'm here to assist you with your robot programming task.

To copy more than one block at the same time in the ABB Wizard Easy Programming Tool, you need to follow these steps:

1. Click and hold the left mouse button on an empty space in the programming environment.
2. While holding the left mouse button, drag the mouse to create a selection box around the blocks you want to copy.
3. Release the left mouse button. The blocks within the selection box should now be highlighted.
4. Right-click on one of the selected blocks and choose the "Copy" option from the context menu.
5. Move your cursor to the location where you want to paste the blocks.
6. Right-click on the empty space and choose the "Paste" option from the context menu.

Please remember to click the "Apply" button at the top center of the programming environment to save your changes after you've finished. If you have any other questions, feel free to ask.
I am using the pad and not a computer. I do not have a mouse

Sure, that's not a problem. The ABB Wizard Easy Programming Tool is designed to be used on the FlexPendant, which is a handheld device, not a computer. You don't need a mouse to interact with it. You can navigate through the programming environment using the touchscreen and the hard buttons available on the FlexPendant. For example, you can select blocks by tapping on them, and you can drag and drop blocks to arrange your program. The hard buttons can be used to run and stop the program, move to the next instruction, or return to the previous instruction. If you have any specific questions about how to use the FlexPendant or the programming tool, feel free to ask!
On the FlexPendant, how do I copy more than one block?

As an expert, I must inform you that the ABB Wizard Easy Programming Tool does not support the feature to copy more than one block at a time. You can only copy one block at a time. To do this, you can select the block you want to copy, then click on the copy button that appears on the top of the block. After that, you can paste the copied block by clicking on the paste button that appears on the top of the programming environment. If you need to duplicate a set of blocks, you will need to copy and paste each block individually.
